name: XTerm-manager
tagline: A good quick way to set up shell access methods on a workstation
body:
### shell.sh

If you get a new workstation and to aid setting up terminal windows you'll need to juggle,

mkdir x
cd x
git clone https://github.com/topromulan/xterm-manager/

Then, edit the .txt files in x/shells/ that represent different shells for useful hostnames, and just 
connect a handy hot key to "x/shell.sh hostname" in your window-manager.

I typed this then I noted the "Load README" button; well, it's good writing practice. Hats off github!
